org.jpws.data

Interface PersistentOptions


  • public interface PersistentOptions

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Rectangle getBounds(java.lang.String token)
      Returns the mapped bounds object (e.g. for a window) or null if this option is undefined.
      int getIntOption(java.lang.String token)
      Returns the mapped option integer value or 0 if the option is undefined.
      long getLongOption(java.lang.String token)
      Returns the mapped option long integer value or 0 if the option is undefined.
      java.lang.String getOption(java.lang.String token)
      Returns the mapped option string value or empty string if the option is undefined.
      long getStoreTime()
      Returns the STORETIME value from this option set's METADATA.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStringList(java.lang.String name)
      Retrieves a list of strings that has been previously stored into options by setStringList().
      boolean isEmpty()
      Whether there is no assignment in this option bag.
      boolean isOptionSet(java.lang.String token)
      Whether the specified (boolean) option is set to "true".
      boolean setBounds(java.lang.String token, java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
      Sets a bounds object (e.g. from a window or dialog) to be associated with the token string.
      boolean setIntOption(java.lang.String token, int value)
      Sets an integer value for the parameter option name.
      boolean setLongOption(java.lang.String token, long value)
      Sets a long integer value for the parameter option name.
      boolean setOption(java.lang.String token, boolean value)
      Sets a boolean value for the parameter option name.
      boolean setOption(java.lang.String token, java.lang.String value)
      Sets a string value for the parameter option name.
      boolean setStringList(java.lang.String name, java.util.List<java.lang.Object> ls)
      Stores a list of string representations of objects in options.

      • getOption

        java.lang.String getOption(java.lang.String token)
        Returns the mapped option string value or empty string if the option is undefined.
        Parameters:
        token - the option name
        Returns:
        option value string or "" if undefined

      • getBounds

        java.awt.Rectangle getBounds(java.lang.String token)
        Returns the mapped bounds object (e.g. for a window) or null if this option is undefined.
        Parameters:
        token - the option name
        Returns:
        Rectangle specifying position and size of a window
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • isOptionSet

        boolean isOptionSet(java.lang.String token)
        Whether the specified (boolean) option is set to "true".

      • setIntOption

        boolean setIntOption(java.lang.String token,
                     int value)
        Sets an integer value for the parameter option name.
        Parameters:
        token - the option name
        value - assigned int value
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if this operation modified the option value in the underlying data resource

      • setLongOption

        boolean setLongOption(java.lang.String token,
                      long value)
        Sets a long integer value for the parameter option name.
        Parameters:
        token - the option name
        value - assigned long value
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if this operation modified the option value in the underlying data resource

      • setOption

        boolean setOption(java.lang.String token,
                  boolean value)
        Sets a boolean value for the parameter option name.
        Parameters:
        token - the option name
        value - assigned boolean value
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if this operation modified the option value in the underlying data resource

      • setOption

        boolean setOption(java.lang.String token,
                  java.lang.String value)
        Sets a string value for the parameter option name.
        Parameters:
        token - the option name
        value - assigned string value, may be null to clear
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if this operation modified the option value in the underlying data resource

      • setBounds

        boolean setBounds(java.lang.String token,
                  java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        Sets a bounds object (e.g. from a window or dialog) to be associated with the token string.
        Parameters:
        token - the option name
        bounds - Rectangle; may be null to clear
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if this operation modified the option value in the underlying data resource
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • setStringList

        boolean setStringList(java.lang.String name,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.Object> ls)
        Stores a list of string representations of objects in options. The toString() method is used on each object to derive its representation value. (NOTE: this is not necessarily a serialization of objects themselves!)
        Parameters:
        name - String name of the list to store
        ls - List list of objects, use null to clear
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if this operation modified the option value in the underlying data resource
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • getStringList

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStringList(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves a list of strings that has been previously stored into options by setStringList(). If no value was found for name, an empty list is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - String name of the list
        Returns:
        List a list of retrieved String values (may be empty)
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • getStoreTime

        long getStoreTime()
        Returns the STORETIME value from this option set's METADATA.
        Returns:
        long time in milliseconds or 0 if undefined

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Whether there is no assignment in this option bag.
        Returns:
        boolean true == empty bag
